file_content.text: Master Numen seems quite sad to see you leave.
It has been an honor to work with you, Captain. I will be certain not to purge these times from my memory banks.
My goodness, Captain. It is a relief to see you hale and hearty after everything you've been through.
Master Numen... Master Numen! The captain has returned.
Are you sure you're not Balmorran, Captain? I can't name one person who's done more for the resistance.
The Imperials are going nuts about losing the Nebula shipment. I didn't know the Emperor let them use that kind of language.
They're not going through your towns and killing every man taller than a vibroblade, right?
Will they take revenge?
Eh, they did that already. Luckily, we grow 'em short and feisty.
What can I say? Sometimes a girl just needs bigger ordnance.
[Flirt] It was easy.
We've got an old saying here on Balmorra: "It's not the size of the missile but how it hits the target."
It was easy.
Then it's a good thing you're not wasting time trying.
Is that it, then?
What's next?
As far as Senator Dodonna's concerned, you're free to go.
I just hope the Republic is willing to sell us some of it back. We need those Nebula prototypes.
I might be able to arrange that... for a small finder's fee.
I could sell it to you.
Oh...? Oh! I hear you! Ha! Senator Dodonna's gonna love that. Have your man send me the price.
We may not have our planet, but we've got some fat mattresses full of credits, you know?
Oh, Master Numen! I just heard a broadcast--the Voidwolf ordered half the top Imperial leadership here executed.
It's a good day for the resistance. Thanks again, Captain.
What would you give me if I got you your prototypes?
[Flirt] I can arrange that.
Ha! I should have known you wouldn't tamely turn over that kind of payload!
Send me the price later. Right now, let's talk about your finder's fee.
Maybe back at my place?
I'm leaving soon. Is this really the last thing you want to say to me?
[Flirt] Let's talk about us.
Yes, leaving soon. Really soon. Like right now.
No--wait--what we were talking about?
Maybe we should go back to my place and try to remember.
What are you waiting for?
Sounds good. [Kiss him]
What's wrong with right here?
[Flirt] Your place?
Oh, my gracious. I don't think I should be hearing this! I'm a family-friendly model.
No. This is too much. I'm putting my foot down.
Are you two involved? I didn't realize.
I wasn't really going to go with him. Can't blame a girl for a little flirting....
It's alright, Corso.
I can blame him!
No offense meant, friend. You've both done the resistance a great service.
Don't worry. Corso's just a little puppy who won't stop following me.
He's no one important.
Don't go counting on that, Captain. Not if you keep doing this.
You don't own me.
Back off, Corso.
Don't try that, Captain. There's a lot of ground between being controlling and being walked on.
I--I can't watch this.
Why don't I just head back to the ship? I, uh, need to do some engine work.
I'll be at the ship.
Family-friendly. What does--oh, really? Uh, excuse me....
Maybe we should find somewhere more... private.
I'd be a fool to think one night is reason enough to bring someone like you back to somewhere like this.
But I hear the Voidwolf's executed half the Imperial leadership on Balmorra. We could be working in the same circles again after all.
Who knew Balmorra was such a romantic place?
I'll miss you.
Maybe the tourism board can work something up. "Balmorra--rockets, rebels and romance."
It's been fun, Captain. I hope our work brings us together in the future.
You never know where the winds take you.
We'll see.
I'll try to avoid that. It would be awkward.
Don't count on it.
Well, even I can read a cue that blunt. I'll take my leave now, Captain. It's been fun.
I really should get back to my ship.
I shouldn't.
Ah, you break my heart, Captain. But it's nothing a little solder won't fix.
Thanks again for everything you've done.
I'll tell the Senator how important your need is.
I'll see what I can do.
Thank you, Captain. She's more likely to listen if you're the one talking.
That's your problem.
Calm down. I'm not asking for anything. We've got our own ways of working with the Republic.
Best of luck, but I'm out of here.
Goodbye.
At least things here should be a bit easier. The Voidwolf had half a dozen top officials on Balmorra executed.
Thanks again, Captain. I look forward to doing business once Balmorra's ours again.
Where can I find a N'zothian milk bath? It's absolutely the only treatment my skin will tolerate. Hello?
Good bye, Captain.
Master Numen owes you his life.
Remember, only talk to the guards Numen knows. Otherwise, they'll kill you just for selling.
Great sakes! I've just intercepted an Imperial data stream. A foot patrol caught Master Numen and the others.
They're taking them to Camp Vigil!
I'm guessing that's not a "let's sleep under the romantic moonlight" sort of camp?
Camp Vigil?
Camp Vigil is Balmorra's most notorious prison camp--set up by the Voidwolf himself.
Tell me how I can help.
You need a hand?
Are you offering to rescue Master Numen? I knew you were a good sort! You can always trust a droid on these things.
Not my problem.
Well, so you'll rescue him! Isn't that what you people do?
I don't know where you got that impression.
He's got you there, Captain.
I would not be here otherwise.
Is that what you do? I thought you just complain and get shot a lot, then pass out drunk in cheap cantinas....
Master Numen has a pair of field disruptors he intended to use to break our people out.
If you were to smuggle them to him now, he could stage a massive prison break from inside. The Empire will be humiliated!
I don't suppose this prison has a convenient back entrance? Laundry service? Off-site catering?
That's a big "if."
Sorry. My mission on Balmorra doesn't involve chasing stray Twi'leks.
I can't help you.
I'll go right now.
Wait. There's no easy physical way inside.
Sorry. My mission involves staying as far from prisons as possible.
I can't help you.
Master Numen welcomed you here! Do you not feel even a droid's sense of loyalty?
Anyway, you have to save him. Master Numen is the only one who can decode Moff Tyrak's data files.
If you had a tongue, you'd be sticking it out, wouldn't you?
You enjoyed that.
Of course not. My programming does not allow for such petty displays.
Tell me how.
Fine.
Watch your tone, or your master may be short one droid when he gets back.
But I don't need you.
Of--of course, sir.
Master Numen has cultivated contacts among those Camp Vigil guards with weaknesses for stims and other restricted imports.
If you make his deliveries to the corrupt guards, you should be able to gain access to the camp, if not the prison itself.
Corrupt guards are my favorite kind.
Sounds good.
These guys are probably trying to hide their habits, right?
How will I recognize them?
I can make them let me in.
I'll get into the prison.
Exactly.
I'll give you IDs on the guards, and we'll hide the field disruptors in your clothes....
And you're ready to go. Just head for Sobrik--Camp Vigil is just inside.
I believe Private Wicke's on duty at the entrance tonight. I'm sure you'll find a way to convince him to let you in.
Oh, dear. Captain, I cannot say how relieved I am to see you!
After you left, Master Numen went to meet with some resistance fighters, and he never made it back!
Numen can handle himself without a babysitter.
It's alright.
But these Imperial soldiers are so vicious. They see heroic freedom fighters like Master Numen as--
Is it true the payment was for an Imperial Moff?
Who's Moff Tyrak?
What were--? Oh, yes, the double agent! Moff Tyrak, indeed. You seem to be in one piece, so I trust that went well?
So what?
I'm sorry. I didn't realize Twi'lek empathy circuits were so prone to shorting.
I'm sorry, I didn't realize empathy circuits had such poor functioning in some humans.
Use caution, Captain. Those Imperial probe droids have quite violent programming.
Greetings, Captain. I am C-6RR, a class-six protocol droid in the service of Numen Brock.
My master most often refers to me as Sixer. I believe he sees it as an... affectionate nickname.
Sorry, buddy. I'm on a schedule.
Where's Numen Brock?
It's so rare to meet a man who really loves his droid.
Sounds like a nut.
Indeed! Many people actually take protocol droids for granted. It's as if our feelings don't....
Oh. Was that sarcasm? My non-literal context analysis function is... I'll get the master.
Put a sock in it.
My goodness! I certainly didn't mean any affront.
Master Numen! Master Numen, the, uh, visitor you were expecting has arrived.
So... what brings you to Balmorra, Captain? Other than the fat Republic payoff?
They're so busy hiding behind treaties, they're handing out credits like candy. I mean, folks like you and me can make a killing.
I was told there's some horrific weapons of death and destruction the Republic doesn't want the Imperial Army getting its hands on.
That's the idea.
The same Republic who walked out on us when the Voidwolf sent his death squads? Doesn't exactly buy them the moral high ground.
Just how much do you think we have in common?
[Flirt] You and me?
You got blasters, brains, beauty... I reckon quite a lot.
Don't talk to her like that. You okay if this guy talks to you like that?
So, what's your role in all this?
Who are you again?
Ironic.
In peacetime, I'd have been a wanted man by both the Republic and Balmorra. And now they call me "commander."
Master Numen specializes in cryptographic analysis. He oversees all encoded Republic communications. It's very exciting!
I deal with the SIS's double agent. Code name: "Golden." He's how we heard about the Nebula shipment.
How's the situation look on the ground?
Give me the status report.
The Republic left us the minute the Voidwolf's fleet started firing. The Empire's pretty entrenched by now.
I should warn you, Captain, many find the Republic's abandonment a bit of a... sore spot.
Though, Republic intel did point us to the Nebula shipment. Came through an SIS double agent. Code name: "Golden."
I never trust a man with a code name.
Sounds suspicious.
He's given us some of our best information. Without him, we wouldn't have taken Bugtown.
But we need to be extremely careful in our communications: codes, dead drops, no face-to-face contact.
Tell me what we know.
Golden's how we learned the Imperials are planning to ship the Nebula munitions to their front lines.
Naturally, communication is risky--so it's codes, dead drops, no face-to-face contact.
We've got a payment due. In return, he says he's got a location for the Nebula shipment. I need you to make the drop-off.
Intrigue makes me surly.
Just give me the mission.
To divert the Nebula shipment, first we need to learn when and where it goes out. Golden's got that information.
We need you to get to his dead drop behind Imperial lines, pick up the data file he left and drop off our payment.
I get the feeling this is a lot more complicated than you make it sound.
What's the catch?
You think?
I don't know... that sounded pretty complicated to me.
There are risks.
Yeah. Sometimes even the most innocent-seeming people can be planning to lead you into a trap--sorry. Sore subject.
The last agent we sent never came back. The Imperials held a public execution.
I'm here for the shipment; get someone else to take this guy his credits.
I'm not your mailman.
So, let's go.
It's really just futile to warn you about danger, isn't it?
How hard can it be?
I am ready.
I really admire that, Captain. How you deliberately challenge yourself by refusing to even hear the details of your missions. I'm going to try that!
I see why the Republic loves you.
This is one of our most dangerous operations. The last agent we sent was caught and publicly executed.
So, you'll need to hit a series of decoy dead drops to flush out any tails before you go to the Okara Droid Factory for the real deal.
Should I just follow the signs for "traitorous double agent dead drop"?
What am I looking for?
I'll transmit the decoy points. The real drop-off is in the Okara Droid Factory.
A little slower, please.
We don't want the Imperials tracking you to the real site, so you'll need to leave false packages at different decoy locations, first.
What kind of opposition should I expect?
Who's guarding it?
The factory is well into occupied territory, go in quiet.
Oh, and the probe droids, Master Numen! Don't forget the probe droids.
Right. If you see a probe droid, take it down before it can transmit or you'll have half a division on you.
Once you find the drop in the Okara Droid Factory, leave the payment and pick up the data file Golden left.
Just leave the payment and pick up the data file Golden left.
